text: hey guys it's Elise and welcome back to

Butter Cup it's not so giant that you

either way let's get started on today's

I'm gonna leave all of your quantities

I've got an offset spatula a spoon and a

some smooth peanut butter some salted
butter and some melted milk chocolate
I've got a large mixing bowl and you can
use a wooden spoon here but to save my

a little bit of baking paper so first up
we need to line the base of our tin so
like I said mines removable and I'm just
gonna place a piece of baking paper over
it flip it over and then just fold that

the ones with a removable base because
the chocolate tends to move around if

in a generous amount of that milk

to scoop it up the sides of my little

that I get it not too thin on the sides
not too thick in the corners and

lie

nicely combined this mix just supposed

your chocolate shells gonna be quite

here when you squeeze it it's quite firm
almost like a cookie dough or a fondant
so you want to put all of your peanut

now and this is where the nonstick is

it's got a bit more structure so I'm
using a lot of pressure and a lot of

here's your offset spatula or even your

place it straight into your base and it
